etymologies: modern Latin, from French petun, from Guarani petȳ ‘tobacco’ (to which these plants are related)

definitions: a plant of the nightshade family with brightly colored funnel-shaped flowers. Native to tropical America, it has been widely developed as an ornamental hybrid, with numerous varieties.
shortDefinitions: South American plant of nightshade family which has white, purple, or red funnel-shaped flowers
